quotes.quote: It is not only fine feathers that make fine birds.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: One swallow does not make a summer.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: How helpless we are, like netted birds, when we are caught by desire!
quotes.author: Belva Plain

quotes.quote: I realized that If I had to choose, I would rather have birds than airplanes.
quotes.author: Charles Lindbergh

quotes.quote: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: Fall is my favorite season in Los Angeles, watching the birds change color and fall from the trees.
quotes.author: David Letterman

quotes.quote: I hope you love birds too. It is economical. It saves going to heaven.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
quotes.author: Eric Berne

quotes.quote: I once had a sparrow alight upon my shoulder for a moment, while I was hoeing in a village garden, and I felt that I was more distinguished by that circumstance that I should have been by any epaulet I could have worn.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Use what talents you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
quotes.author: Henry Van Dyke

quotes.quote: Those little nimble musicians of the air, that warble forth their curious ditties, with which nature hath furnished them to the shame of art.
quotes.author: Izaak Walton

quotes.quote: God loved the birds and invented trees. Man loved the birds and invented cages.
quotes.author: Jacques Deval

quotes.quote: The very idea of a bird is a symbol and a suggestion to the poet. A bird seems to be at the top of the scale, so vehement and intense his life. . . . The beautiful vagabonds, endowed with every grace, masters of all climes, and knowing no bounds -- how many human aspirations are realised in their free, holiday-lives -- and how many suggestions to the poet in their flight and song!
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.quote: I value my garden more for being full of blackbirds than of cherries, and very frankly give them fruit for their songs.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: I know why the caged bird sings.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Cranes carry this heavy mystical baggage. They're icons of fidelity and happiness. The Vietnamese believe cranes cart our souls up to heaven on our wings.
quotes.author: Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote: Our avian brothers are back to roost on the first leg of their annual sojourn south. Why them and not us? Maybe it's because we humans are meant to be rooted in one spot.
quotes.author: Mitchell Burgess

quotes.quote:
There'll be bluebirds over the white cliffs of Dover,
Tomorrow, just you wait and see.
quotes.author: Nat Burton

quotes.quote: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.
quotes.author: Robert Lynd

quotes.quote: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?
quotes.author: Rose Kennedy

quotes.quote: Much talking is the cause of danger. Silence is the means of avoiding misfortune. The talkative parrot is shut up in a cage. Other birds, without speech, fly freely about.
quotes.author: Saskya Pandita

quotes.quote: I know of only one bird - the parrot - that talks; and it can't fly very high.
quotes.author: Wilbur Wright

quotes.quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: When thou seest an eagle, thou seest a portion of genius; lift up thy head!
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: You cannot fly like an eagle with the wings of a wren.
quotes.author: William Henry Hudson
